text: That's absurd
The odds.
Hahaha. Felt so good.
I would love to have heard your opponent’s reaction.
I’m sure he said “How bad could it be?”
Right before Gishack opened the park. Chaos theory in action
That rage scoop but a big smile on Gishath's face.
He got to have his fun...Dino’s just need more.

Scryfall recently underwent a change in how they manage and expose color identities: 

<https://scryfall.com/changelog/improvements-to-color-color-identity-operators-138>

attachments.title: Improvements to color/color identity operators · Scryfall Changelog
attachments.text: Magic’s relationship with colors is…complicated. The color pie is ever-changing and inconsistent, rules for colors and color identities are complex, and mana bases require a PhD in mathematics to accurately craft.
attachments.fallback: Scryfall Magic Card Search: Improvements to color/color identity operators · Scryfall Changelog

text: This looks pretty sweet.
Imagine if [[Teferi’s protection]] said “Target player”...

attachments.fallback: Teferi's Protection {2}{W} // Instant // Until your next turn, your life total can't change and you have protection from everything. All permanents you control phase out. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. They phase in before you untap during your untap step.) // Exile Teferi's Protection.
attachments.text:
Instant
Until your next turn, your life total can't change and you have protection from everything. All permanents you control phase out. _(While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. They phase in before you untap during your untap step.)_
Exile Teferi's Protection.
attachments.title: Teferi's Protection {2}{W}

text: I found a play set of concordant crossroads sorting bulk last night while watching league of legends so that was nice
<@U4V5EHQ2G> is breaking bulk...

I’m driving to upper Michigan today to help my mom move and when I take the trip I usually check Facebook and Craig’s list for places along the way for people selling magic cards. I found one and contacted the lady
That doesn't work here in Austin. Unless you get incredibly lucky any collection gets snapped up quickly.
She said she has a box of magic cards from the 90’s that she wanted ten dollars for. I didn’t ask much else because ten bucks is hard to lose out on
We agreed to meet and that was it. Then this morning out of the blue she sent me a picture
Wait...does this story go all 'Penthouse letters'?
They were oversized playing cards for magic tricks
Yikes!
It’ll give me a good podcast story I guess
Yessssthat story is amazing
Priceless!!!! Hey, you wanted magic cards right?!
Besides, 10 bucks is hard to lose out on.
But apparently not impossible.
She apologized like 20 times about it after too
This is great podcast material.
Y'know...I realize one card they never gave us in Kaladesh block is an 'energy-drain' effect where you can remove energy from a player.
I was expecting it in revolt
Didn't MaRo say they didn't want to hose the new mechanic?
Something along those lines. I remember reading about it. Also, removing counters from players probably wasn’t something they wanted to do, and a card removing energy probably wasn’t worth a slot.
I mean, there are very few cards that remove poison counters
Sure but Energy is a resource and they tend to give us ways of interacting with our opponents resources.
Only issue I can see is unless they specifically mentioned energy, it could work for anything. Like poison or experience Counters
I expected them to say energy.
Got a box of Conspiracy 2 from the last eBay flash sale. This is how it was shipped, so thanks to the seller for letting me throw away their trash for them
I was just updating my Maelstrom Wanderer deck, and it was always a value engine, but [[Sunbird’s Invocation]] gets a bit overwhelming while goldfishing.

attachments.fallback: Sunbird's Invocation {5}{R} // Enchantment // Whenever you cast a spell from your hand, reveal the top X cards of your library, where X is that spell's converted mana cost. You may cast a card revealed this way with converted mana cost X or less without paying its mana cost. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
attachments.text:
Enchantment
Whenever you cast a spell from your hand, reveal the top X cards of your library, where X is that spell's converted mana cost. You may cast a card revealed this way with converted mana cost X or less without paying its mana cost. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
attachments.title: Sunbird's Invocation {5}{R}

text: Isn't it almost another copy of maelstrom nexus
Or whatever that enchantment is that makes everything cascade,
It’s better because that only cascades the first spell. THIS IS EVERY FREAKIN’ SPELL from your hand.
And it’s better than Cascade because it’s X or less, not less than X.
One time I had Seedborn Muse, Leyline of Anticipation and managed to cast the invocation. I was drunk on value.
Yeah
Hot
Invocation is going to wind up in every Red deck
Just because it's insane
Remember your good buddy Matt reviewed it on <http://edhrec.com|edhrec.com> and said it would be a super fun card that should probably be a mythic
It's #Rediculous, right <@U3QMCLQQG>;)
I gotta get better about reading everyone's articles each day
Also, any Wanderer deck not running Cream of the Crop isn’t having fun.
I'll admit, I don't read most of them O.O
I usually do, usually at the end of the week so none of my comments would ever be relevant
Jason reads my series concept and then writes about it himself
To much more fanfare though.
[[Cream of the Crop]] isn’t played enough. Any creature-heavy green deck is just dropping so much value on the floor not running it. For 2 mana it’s crazy good.

attachments.fallback: Cream of the Crop {1}{G} // Enchantment // Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may look at the top X cards of your library, where X is that creature's power. If you do, put one of those cards on top of your library and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
attachments.text:
Enchantment
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may look at the top X cards of your library, where X is that creature's power. If you do, put one of those cards on top of your library and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
attachments.title: Cream of the Crop {1}{G}

text: Seems like a great card for [[Momir Vig]]

attachments.fallback: Momir Vig, Simic Visionary {3}{G}{U} // Legendary Creature — Elf Wizard // Whenever you cast a green creature spell, you may search your library for a creature card and reveal it. If you do, shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. // Whenever you cast a blue creature spell, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put that card into your hand. // 2/2
attachments.text:
Legendary Creature — Elf Wizard
Whenever you cast a green creature spell, you may search your library for a creature card and reveal it. If you do, shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
Whenever you cast a blue creature spell, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put that card into your hand.
*2/2*
attachments.title: Momir Vig, Simic Visionary {3}{G}{U}

text: It isn’t even drawing the card! So it gets around any draw hate.
I didn't read your series concept or any of your articles
I play Cream of the Crop in Maelstrom Wanderer
You told me not to bother you with trifles.
It’s just a silly good card.
I do love me some trifles
What about Cream with something like [[Zendikar's Resurgent]]

attachments.fallback: Zendikar Resurgent {5}{G}{G} // Enchantment // Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana to your mana pool of any type that land produced. (The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless.) // Whenever you cast a creature spell, draw a card.
attachments.text:
Enchantment
Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana to your mana pool of any type that land produced. _(The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless.)_
Whenever you cast a creature spell, draw a card.
attachments.title: Zendikar Resurgent {5}{G}{G}

text: Oh, nevermind
You'd draw before you could search

The only time I've ever seen cream of the crop was a buddies all Japanese foil maelstrom wanderer deck, and he didn't actually know what the card did so he never really remember the triggers when it was out
It’s on ETB so if you can flicker critters....the value.
I was thinking Resurgent would a) allow you to draw the card you just searched and b) give you extra mana to keep going
The. Ingest problem with it is the decks that can best abuse it tends to run small creatures
This is not the way of things :disappointed:
It does make [[sylvan caryatid]] SOOOOOO GOOOOOOOD!

I really should try it in Reki as a way to cascade creature into creature

In my testing I find [[Decaying Soil]] to be a star in the deck.

attachments.fallback: Decaying Soil {1}{B}{B} // Enchantment // At the beginning of your upkeep, exile a card from your graveyard. // Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Decaying Soil has "Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, return that card to your hand."
attachments.text:
Enchantment
At the beginning of your upkeep, exile a card from your graveyard.
_Threshold_ — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Decaying Soil has "Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, return that card to your hand."
attachments.title: Decaying Soil {1}{B}{B}
